articles.description: Sir Curtly Ambrose, who was one of the vital cogs of the West Indies’ pace quartet, has admitted that if Jasprit Bumrah can stay fit and strong, he can easily surpass the 400 Test wickets mark. He also insisted that Bumrah’s short run-up wouldn’t put too much…
articles.content: "You know in terms of fast bowling, it's generally about rhythm. So, you need to build a good rhythm before you can deliver. Bumrah has got a very short run up. He walks most of the way and maybe one… [+290 chars]
